question: A 22-year-old obese, married nulliparous woman visits a gynecologist for irregular menstrual cycles for the past 1 year. On examination, it was found that she has hirsutism, alopecia, and acanthosis nigricans. Her ultrasound shows multiple fluid-filled sacs in the ovary. What does this indicate?

A 3-month-old male infant is brought to the outpatient department (OPD) for a routine check-up. On thorough examination, it is found that he has cryptorchidism. Which of the following best describes the condition?

answers.option: Accumulation of fluid in the testes
Testes fail to descend into the scrotum

question: A 46-year-old female presents with a history of infection in her perineal region. On comprehensive examination, it was found that the superior boundary of superficial perineal space is torn. Which structure is most likely to be injured?
Which of the following is a remnant of paramesonephric duct in males?
Which of the following is a common intermediate in the estrogen synthesis?
What is the source of human chorionic gonadotropin hormone in a woman in whom fertilization has occurred two weeks before?
Which of the following is the most common contraceptive method used in Pakistan?
Which one of the following represents the female pelvis with a greater transverse diameter of the outlet than the anteroposterior diameter?
Which of the following hormones is used to detect pregnancy?
What is the primary source of progesterone in late pregnancy?

During model studies, the students were discussing the boundaries of the ischiorectal fossa. One student pointed out the structure forming its medial wall. Which structure forms the medial wall of the ischiorectal fossa?
Which one of the following best describes the components of reproductive health?

answers.option: Health of youth, contraception, abortion, and sexually transmitted diseases
Maternal health, child health and diseases of females
General health of public, abortion and contraception
Public health, maternal health and contraception

question: Ovulation occurs in response to which of the following hormones?
The proliferation of the corpus luteum is promoted by prolactin which stimulates the production of which of the following?
Which of the following increases in case of damage to the hypothalamus?
Which of these immunoglobulins can cross the placental barrier?
The secretion of inhibin is caused by which of the following?
Which type of cells are present in breast milk?

answers.option: Red blood cells and plasma cells

question: Which of the following parts of the ductal system of the male reproductive system has a pseudostratified epithelial lining with some cells having sparse stereocilia?
Hemoglobin and hematocrit levels are at their lowest levels at which stage of pregnancy?
Androstenedione contains how many carbons?
What is the WHO recommended duration for exclusive breastfeeding?
Higher than normal levels of progesterone are found in which of the following conditions?
In granulosa cells of follicles, testosterone is converted to beta-estradiol. Which of the following enzymes is important for this conversion?
Which of the following is primarily a prolactin-inhibiting hormone secreted by the hypothalamus?
When the internal iliac artery is damaged, what anastomosis provides compensation for blood flow?
Which is not true about Sertoli cells?

answers.option: Are large and have irregular outlines

question: Which of the following aptly defines gender?

answers.option: How a patient identifies themselves according to their roles in society

question: Major contribution to semen is from which of the following?
Which of these follicles is seen in the prepubertal stage?
What is the major form of estrogen produced from menarche till menopause?
During ligation of the uterine artery, which of the following structures have the chance of being ligated along with it?
Tearing of the pelvic diaphragm during childbirth can lead to the paralysis of which of the following?
Which of the following hormones are involved in the luteal phase?
Which of the following is a part of the urogenital diaphragm?
Which of the following is an intermediate in the biogenic synthesis of adrenocortical hormones?
Which of the following statements is wrong about the Sertoli cells?

answers.option: They are not present in the interstitial space
Sertoli cells have darker nuclei as compared to primary spermatogonia
They secrete a compound called Mullerian inhibiting factor (MIF)
They provide nourishment to primary spermatogonia
They form tight junctions and connective adhesion molecules with neighboring Sertoli cells

question: Which of the following is the first hormone secreted by the placenta?
Which of the following lymph nodes do testes drain into?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding prostate?

answers.option: Central zone is around ejaculatory ducts
70% of prostate cancer originates in the peripheral zone

question: The lower one-third of the vagina drains into which of the following?

answers.option: The common and internal iliac nodes
The superficial inguinal and perirectal nodes

question: Which of the following is true regarding the vaginal mucosa?

answers.option: It is lined by stratified columnar epithelium
It is lined by stratified squamous keratinized epithelium
It does not possess elastic fibers
It is lubricated by the glands located in the cervix

question: During the 5th week, what is formed by the mesenchymal proliferation on the medial side of mesonephros?
Which of the following is not required for fertilization?
Which of the following is not true about the oviduct?

answers.option: The muscle layer consists of an outer longitudinal layer and inner circular layer.
Intramural portion extends through the uterine wall
The proximal part is called isthmus

question: Which of the following drains into the portal vein?
Which of the following is more likely to get damaged during catheterization?
Which of the following ensures storage and maturation of sperms, and joins the ductus deferens?
Which of these increases reception of cervical mucus to the sperm movement?
Ideally, when should intrauterine devices (IUDs) be implanted?
Which of the following is odd regarding Graffian follicle?
As a result of damage to the spongy urethra, where does the urine start to escape into?
Which of the following protects young women against heart disease?
Which of the following represents the stage in which the follicle is arrested in the prophase-I of the first meiotic division?
Which of these is an effect of progesterone on the uterine endometrium?

answers.option: It works synergistically with estrogen to increase proliferation
It increases glycogen deposition in the glandular epithelium
It converts glands from coiled to tubular forms
It causes regression of spiral arteries

question: A fetus is born with an enlarged clitoris and fused labia majora/minora. Ultrasound confirms that the fetus is female. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following features is the most prominent and can be used to identify fallopian tubes?

answers.option: Muscularis has three layers; longitudinal, circular, and oblique

question: A deficiency of iodine in maternal blood can cause which condition in a child?
Regarding the blood-testis barrier, which of the following is the most inappropriate statement?

answers.option: Formed by contact of lateral processes of Sertoli cells
Prevents autoimmune reaction of secondary spermatocytes
Only present in basal compartment of seminiferous tubules

question: What is the meaning of empowerment?
A doctor after a thorough examination diagnosed a patient with benign prostatic hyperplasia. He gives him 5-alpha reductase inhibitor to decrease which of the following?

A diabetic patient comes to the clinic with complaints of high-grade fever and a purulent discharge from a small opening in the perineal region. After examination, a diagnosis of abscess in the ischio-anal fossa is made. Which of the following structures forms the medial boundary of the ischioanal fossa?

A newly married female patient comes to the gynecology consultant clinic with complaints of pain during micturition and a purulent discharge from the vagina. After examination, a diagnosis of bacterial infection is made. It causes the obstruction of the paraurethral glands. Inflamed glands are homologous with which of the following structures in males?

A female patient comes to the gynecology outpatient department with complaints of pain and swelling in the external genitalia which increases while walking or weight lifting. On examination, a diagnosis of inguinal hernia is made due to the termination of the round ligament of the uterus in the external genitalia. The above-mentioned ligament terminates in which of the following structures?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding the main supports of the uterus?
Which of the following arteries in males is replaced by a vaginal artery in females?
Ovarian arteries arise from which of the following vessels?
Which of the following is inappropriate regarding histological features of the early proliferative phase of the endometrium?

answers.option: Epithelial cells acquire cilia and microvilli

question: Which of the following cells are present in the interstitium of the testes?
Which of the following statements is inappropriate regarding the corpora amylacea?

answers.option: Condensations of secretory products of prostate

question: Ovaries of a young girl who has not yet reached puberty contain which of the following structures?
Which of the following represents a fold of peritoneum extending from the ovaries to the pelvic wall containing blood vessels and nerves?
Which of the following epithelial transition is seen between the vagina and the cervix?

answers.option: Simple columnar to simple squamous epithelium
Stratified squamous to simple columnar epithelium
Stratified squamous to stratified columnar epithelium
Simple squamous to stratified columnar epithelium
Simple squamous to simple columnar epithelium

question: Which stage of the follicle is marked by the conversion of cells surrounding the oocyte from squamous to cuboidal cells?
During the development of the male reproductive system, gonadal cords or primitive sex cords develop in the gonadal ridges. These cords give rise to which of the following structures?

The mesonephric ducts or Wolfian ducts play an important role in the development of male genital ducts. Secretions from which of the following have a crucial part in the normal development of these ducts?
In an embryo with XX sex chromosome genotype, fallopian tubes, uterus, and the vagina is formed in the absence of Mullerian inhibiting factor. Which of the following gives rise to these structures?
From which of the following does the external urethral meatus develop?
Which of the following is not a derivative of the Wolffian ducts?
At which stage of the menstrual cycle does the progesterone rise to its highest level?

answers.option: At the start of the luteinizing hormone (LH) surge

question: At which of the following stages of the menstrual cycle does the estrogen rise to its highest value?
Which cells of the ovary secrete estrogen in the follicular phase of the menstrual cycle?

At the time of parturition, there is increased contractility of the uterine walls. This is said to be induced by the increased levels of estrogen near the end of the pregnancy. How does the estrogen increase contractility of the walls?

answers.option: It increases the number of smooth muscle fibers
It increases the number and sensitivity of receptors
It increases the vascularity of the uterine wall

question: Suckling action of a baby on breasts with the help of which of the following two hormones increases milk production and secretion?

answers.option: Follicular stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone

question: Which of the following hormones is responsible for the development of ducts and the deposition of fat in the stromal tissue of the breast?
Which of the following hormones is responsible for the development of the lobules and alveoli in the breast?
Which of the following hormones is produced in pregnancy and almost exclusively in the placenta?
Which of the following hormonal scenarios happens towards the end of pregnancy and is partly responsible for increased contractility of the uterine walls?
Prolactin is classified into which of the following biochemical groups?
Receptors for the estrogen are present in which of the following?
The anterior pituitary gland secretes many hormones which regulate the functions of other glands in the body. Which of these hormones is not secreted from the anterior pituitary?
Which of the following hormones increases at puberty to initiate the menstrual cycle?
Which of the following enzymes catalyzes the synthesis of estrogen from androgen in circulation?
Raised luteinizing hormone and decreased testosterone levels in the serum indicate the failure of which of the following?
As menstruation ends, estrogen levels in the blood rise rapidly. What is the source of estrogen?
Which of the following enzymes is required to convert testosterone to estradiol?
Administration of which vitamins will prevent the neural tube defects from occurring?

A middle-aged female patient presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of on and off pelvic pain. She denies any abnormal vaginal discharge or other associated symptoms. Ultrasonography reveals the presence of multiple ovarian cystic lesions filled with clear fluid and most of them were around 2 centimeters in diameter. Which of the following cysts originates from unruptured Graffian follicles or from follicles that ruptured and immediately sealed?

A female patient presented with multiple whitish vaginal lesions. She also reported itching in the affected area but has no other comorbidity. Her gynecologist ordered a biopsy to help identify the underlying cause which was further diagnosed as squamous cell hyperplasia. Which of the following is a characteristic feature of the disorder mentioned above?

A young female presented to the clinic with the complaint of irregular menstrual cycles. She was married for the last six years but was unable to conceive. Ultrasonography revealed multiple ovarian cysts. Which of the following is the main biochemical abnormality in this condition?

A middle-aged female presented to the clinic with complaints of irregular menstrual cycle and excessive body hair. She was unmarried and had hypertension for the last three years. Ultrasonography revealed multiple ovarian cysts. Which of the following biochemical abnormalities is associated with the polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS)?
Various congenital anomalies may develop in the female genital tract during embryological development. Which of the following statements is correct regarding these anomalies?

answers.option: Diethylstilbestrol is associated with congenital anomalies and is still used.
Vaginal adenosis refers to small residual patches of glandular epithelium in adult life
Imperforate hymen is also called vaginal atresia
Gartner duct cyst arise from the mesonephric duct and is present in the wall of the uterus.
Uterus didelphys refers to the single uterus with two vaginas

question: An unmarried teenage girl undergoes a secret abortion to get rid of unwanted pregnancy. The process was carried out by using dirty knitting needles. After one week she develops abdominal pain, fever, and purulent vaginal discharge. Which of the following statements is correct regarding the condition of this patient?

answers.option: She can be treated with antipyretics and sent home
Complicated candida infection is the most common cause of this etiology
The smear made from this vaginal discharge would show Trichomonas vaginalis
Pyosalpinx and tubo-ovarian abscesses are extremely unlikely to occur
Most likely diagnosis is pelvic inflammatory disease due to multiple micro-organisms

question: Which of the following represents the karyotype of a partial mole?

A 25-year-old married woman is brought to the emergency room with complaints of severe abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding. Her husband informs the doctor that she is 10 weeks pregnant and was scheduled to visit her doctor for an ultrasound but she could not go. Examination reveals severe pallor and acute abdomen. Ultrasound reveals the distended fallopian tubes and intraperitoneal hemorrhage. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most effective clinical contraceptive with the least chances of failure?

A 56-year-old male is diagnosed with neurosyphilis. He never got treatment for the disease and knows nothing about the illness except for the fact that his friend told him not to tell anyone about the disease and not to visit the doctor as it is a disease that would bring shame to him. Which of the following played a major role as a barrier to seeking proper treatment?

answers.option: Lack of proper education regarding sexual and reproductive health

question: You are having a conversation with your colleagues regarding the state of reproductive health in Pakistan which includes large family size, unwanted pregnancies, and high maternal and neonatal mortality rates. Which of the following is the major factor that leads to all of this?

answers.option: Lack of education regarding reproductive health

question: A 25-year-old para 2+0 presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of irregular vaginal bleeding. The duration of her cycle is 11 days occurring every 15 days. Which of the following accurately describes the above-mentioned condition?

A 30-year-old para 3+0 presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of irregular vaginal bleeding. The duration of her menstrual flow is 10 days occurring after every 28 days. Which of the following terms is used for this pattern of bleeding?

A 13-year-old presents to the outpatient department and has passed menarche 6 days ago. She is passing clots and is bleeding heavily. She experiences recurrent episodes of epistaxis and bleeding from her gums. Her hemoglobin is 5 g/dl. What would be the next step in the investigation?

answers.option: Follicle stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone profile

question: A 45-year-old para 1+0 is presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of irregular vaginal bleeding for the last 5 months. Pelvic ultrasound reveals an endometrial thickness of 1.5 centimeters but there is no abnormal uterine or adnexal mass. What would be your next step to investigate the case further?

answers.option: Follicle stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone profile

question: Which of the following hormones is responsible for the engorgement of breasts during early pregnancy?

A woman presents to the clinic with the complaint of cessation of the menstrual cycle for the last 3 months. Previously she had regular menstruation occurring every 30th day and continued for 4 days. On what day of the cycle this woman is most likely to ovulate?
What is the main source of the hormone maintaining the decidual nature of endometrium in the 24th week of the pregnancy?
Which of the following is the source of the hormone responsible for maintaining the decidual nature of the endometrial tissue during the 12th week of the pregnancy?
Which of the following abnormalities is common between epispadias and hypospadias?

A 35-year-old woman Para 2+0 presented in the outpatient department with a complaint of heavy menstrual bleeding. Bleeding above which of the following volumes will be categorized as heavy menstrual bleeding?
Which of the following factors does not play a role in the normal development of testes?

A 25-year-old female para 1+0 presents to the clinic showing concern regarding the health of her newborn baby. The doctor suggests that she feed her baby milk with relatively lower casein, calcium, and lactalbumin but higher lactose for the better development of the nervous system and to reduce the risk of increased burden on the kidneys. Which milk is best for the growth of a newborn child?
A sudden decrease in the circulatory levels of which placental hormone indicates a nonviable pregnancy?
Which of the following hormones is secreted by the placenta and is responsible for maintaining a pregnancy?
In which of the following does secondary meiosis occur?
Which of the following can be the reason for the continuous involuntary flow of urine from vagina?

answers.option: Vesico-vaginal fistula that might develop after delivery
Vesico-uterine fistula that might develop after delivery

question: Which of the following is the most common complication of the intrauterine device method of contraception?

A young lady presents with irregular vaginal bleeding. She is concerned for her health because her mother had cervical carcinoma. The gynecologist advises a pap smear testing which reveals cervical intraepithelial neoplasia. Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia is strongly associated with which of these?
Which one of the following is the convergence point where spermatic vessels and ductus deferens come together?
Which one of the following ligaments prevents prolapse of the uterus?
Which one of the following is the major aim of imparting knowledge regarding reproductive health?

answers.option: So an individual can have broader choices in their life
To live a more fulfilling life in terms of reproduction
To prevent the occurrence of sexually transmitted diseases

question: What is the most common site of ectopic pregnancy?
Which of the following is a condition in which veins draining any one side of the testis are dilated in the lateral scrotum and are optimistic for transillumination?
A pediatrician notices a 4-year-old girl having stained underwear and grape-like masses coming out of the vestibule. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 58-year-old post-menopausal woman presents with heavy bleeding and an adnexal mass. Histopathology reveals an increased gland-to-stroma ratio and the masses are well-circumscribed necrotic and show nuclear atypia. Which of the following is true for her condition?

answers.option: Pregnancy related bleeding should be ruled out
It is due excessive oxytocin released by posterior pituitary
Mutations in PTEN tumor suppressor genes are common
It is due to unopposed high progesterone levels
This condition arises due to an untreated protozoal infection

question: A 16-year-old girl is brought to the hospital with the complaint of delayed menarche. On examination, she has a webbed neck, a broad chest, and widely spaced inverted nipples. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 17-year-old girl presented to the clinic with complaints of primary amenorrhea. She has well-developed breasts and a physical exam shows normal secondary sexual characteristics but a short vagina. The uterus is undetected and two inguinal masses are found instead. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 15-year-old girl experiencing pelvic pain was examined and a mass was found in her ovaries. The mass on excision was white with necrotic patches and had primitive mesenchymal cells of cartilage, muscle tissue, and foci of neuroepithelial differentiation. What is the most likely cause?
A post-menopausal woman having endometrial hyperplasia with increased gland-to-stroma ratio with atypia presented to the outpatient department. What advice would you give her?

answers.option: Reassure her that there is nothing to worry about
Advise her to go for hysterectomy due to risk of carcinoma
Ask her to come for checkup every five years

question: Estrogen is secreted in high concentrations in which of the following phases of the menstrual cycle?
The process of spermatogenesis is controlled by negative feedback to the pituitary to decrease FSH. Which hormone inhibits the secretion of FSH?
To perform the pudendal nerve block, the surgeon palpates a landmark on the ischium. Which of the following is an appropriate landmark?
Which of the following lymph nodes drain the ovaries?
Which of the following chemical substances is a precursor to estrogen?
Which enzyme is responsible for releasing DNA supercoils?

A 49-year-old male patient presented with ureteric obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination showed that the patient has prostatic enlargement and was diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Which of the following is the steroid 5-alpha reductase inhibitor that has been useful in BPH and male pattern baldness?
